ccre.cluck.any

Class CluckNullLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.cluck.any.CluckNullLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CluckLink

    public class CluckNullLink
extends java.lang.Object
implements CluckLink
    A CluckNullLink is a link between two CluckNodes on the same computer, and an example of how to write a link that connects two CluckNodes. Usage example:
    CluckNode alpha = new CluckNode();
    CluckNode beta = new CluckNode();
    CluckNullLink alphaLink = new CluckNullLink(alpha, "alpha-to-beta");
    CluckNullLink betaLink = new CluckNullLink(beta, "beta-to-alpha", alphaLink);

    EventConsumer test = new EventLogger(LogLevel.INFO, "Pseudo-networked test!");
    alpha.publish("test", test);
    EventConsumer test2 = beta.subscribeEC("beta-to-alpha/test");
    test2.eventFired();

    This will log "Pseudo-networked test!" at LogLevel INFO.

    • Method Detail

      • transmit

        public boolean transmit(java.lang.String rest,
               java.lang.String source,
               byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: CluckLink
        Send a Cluck message over this link. Dest and source are forward-slash-separated paths. The destination is relative to the node at the other end of the link - the name of this link has already been stripped off. The source is relative to the previous node - it should get the name of this link on the other end added to it so that messages can be sent in response.
        Specified by:
        transmit in interface CluckLink
        Parameters:
        rest - The destination path.
        source - The source path.
        data - The data packet.
        Returns:
        true if more messages should be delivered, false if this should be detached from the CluckNode.
